name: Sous Vide Corned Beef

steps: Fill a large pot with water and place a sous vide immersion cooker into the water. Set the temperature to 140 degrees F (60 degrees C) according to manufacturer's instructions.. Rinse corned beef under cool water to remove excess salt, then pat dry. Sprinkle seasoning on fatty side and press into beef. Place corned beef into a large vacuum bag; seal using a vacuum sealer.. Place the sealed bag into the water and set a timer for 48 hours.. Transfer corned beef to a cutting board and slice across the grain.

name: Sous Vide Tri Tip
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(2 1/2 to 3 pound)', 'name': 'tri tip steak, fat cap trimmed to 1/4-inch thick'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'toasted sesame oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'kosher salt, divided'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'unsalted butter, cut into 1/2-inch cubes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'coriander seeds, coarsely ground'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'black peppercorns, coarsely ground'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'grapeseed oil'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh lime juice (from 3 large limes)'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fish sauce'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dark brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'garlic cloves, grated with a Microplane grater (about 2 tsp.)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(1 inch) piece', 'name': 'fresh ginger, peeled and grated with a Microplane grater (about 1 1/2 tsp.)'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'green onions, white bottoms finely chopped and green tops thinly sliced crosswise (about 2 Tbsp. minced white bottoms, about 1/4 cup thinly sliced green tops)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'toasted sesame seeds'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'toasted sesame oil'}
steps: Prepare a thermocirculator and water bath according to manufacturer's directions. Set thermocirculator to 135 degrees F (57 degrees C) and allow water bath to come up to temperature.. Using gloved hands, rub tri tip steak evenly with sesame oil and season evenly with 1 teaspoon salt. Transfer tri tip and butter to a large vacuum-sealable bag and arrange in a flat, even layer. Seal bag with a vacuum sealer according to manufacturer's directions.. Transfer vacuum-sealed tri tip to warm water bath with thermocirculator, cover vessel with aluminum foil to reduce evaporation, and cook 3 hours. Remove tri tip from bag (meat will be at 135 degrees F (57 degrees C) when pulled from water bath) and transfer to a rimmed sheet pan lined with paper towels and gently pat dry; discard bag and any juices reserved in bag.. Meanwhile prepare the chile-lime dipping sauce. Whisk together lime juice, fish sauce, brown sugar, garlic, ginger, green onions, sesame seeds, and toasted sesame oil in a small bowl until well combined. Cover dipping sauce with plastic wrap and set aside at room temperature until ready to use.. Season tri tip evenly with remaining 2 teaspoons salt, coriander seeds, and black peppercorns, pressing coriander and black peppercorns into tri tip to adhere.. Heat grapeseed oil in a large cast iron skillet over medium-high heat. Add tri tip to skillet, fat-cap-side down, and cook, until all sides are evenly seared and caramelized, 3 to 5 minutes per side.. Transfer tri tip to a large cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes before slicing against the grain into 1/4-inch-thick strips.. Serve steak with chile-lime dipping sauce for dipping, if desired.

name: Sous Vide Beef Tenderloin Roast
ingredients: {'quantity': '4 ½', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'whole beef tenderloin'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'sea salt/kosher salt (such as Redmonds®)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'freshly ground black pepper, or more to taste'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '', 'name': 'fresh thyme sprigs, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'rosemary sprig'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'unsalted butter, divided, or more as needed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'olive oil, or as needed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'splash', 'name': 'red wine'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'gelatin powder'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cold water'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste'}
steps: Trim and tie tenderloin together with kitchen twine the night before cooking. Combine salt and pepper in a bowl and season tenderloin on all sides. Place on a baking rack set over a cookie sheet and allow to rest, uncovered, in the refrigerator overnight.. The next morning place tenderloin, garlic, thyme, and rosemary into a sous vide vacuum bag and seal using a vacuum sealer. Refrigerate until you are ready to sous vide.. Attach sous vide cooker to a heat-proof container of water and set temperature to 133 degrees F (56 degrees C). Sous vide until tenderloin has reached the desired temperature, 2 1/2 to 3 hours, depending on thickness.. About 30 minutes pour water in a metal bowl and sprinkle gelatin powder on top. Allow to sit for 30 minutes until gelatin blooms. Set on top of a double boiler over simmering water and stir until a clear liquid forms. Do not allow to boil.. Remove tenderloin from sous vide, pat dry, and let rest while preparing the gravy.. Pour au jus liquids from the sous vide bag into a sauce pan. Stir in 1 to 2 tablespoons butter and red wine. Add as much of the bloomed gelatin as you like depending on desired thickness and whisk until well combined. Season gravy with salt, pepper, and herbs to taste.. Heat cast iron pan to medium-high. Brush tenderloin with olive oil and sear in the hot pan until browned all over, 1 to 2 minutes per side. Melt extra butter in the pan as desired. Remove from pan, tent with foil, and allow to rest for 5 to 10 minutes.. Slice tenderloin and serve with gravy.

name: Sous Vide Maple Chipotle BBQ Pork Chops
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'ketchup'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'unsalted butter, melted'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'apple cider vinegar'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'maple syrup'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'Dijon mustard'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'chopped canned chipotle chiles in adobo'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'adobo sauce from canned chipotle chiles'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'Worcestershire sauce'}, {'quantity': '2 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'kosher salt, divided'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'chili powder'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'onion powder'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'garlic powder'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'smoked paprika'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'name': '(1 1/4-inch-thick) bone-in, center cut pork chops'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'canola oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'chopped fresh cilantro (Optional)'}
steps: Prepare a thermocirculator and water bath according to manufacturer's directions. Set thermocirculator to 135 degrees F(57 degrees C) (if you want the pork cooked medium instead of medium-rare, set to 145 degrees F (62 degrees C)), and allow water bath to come up to temperature.. Stir together ketchup, melted butter, vinegar, maple syrup, jalapeno, mustard, chipotles, adobo sauce, Worcestershire, 1 teaspoon salt, chili powder, onion powder, garlic powder, and smoked paprika for the sauce in a bowl. You should have about 2 cups sauce.. Season all chops evenly with remaining 1 1/2 teaspoons salt and pepper and place chops in an even layer in a large vacuum sealable bag. Massage bag to be sure each chop is evenly coated in sauce, then seal bag with a vacuum sealer according to manufacturer's directions.. Transfer vacuum-sealed chops to warm water bath with thermocirculator, cover vessel with aluminum foil to reduce evaporation. Preheat a grill or a grill pan to medium-high (400 degrees F to 450 degrees F (200 degrees C to 230 degrees C)).. steps: Fill a large pot with water and place a sous vide immersion cooker into the water. Set temperature to 167 degrees F (75 degrees C) according to manufacturer's instructions; allow 15 minutes for the water to heat.. Gently lower eggs into the water using a slotted spoon. Immediately set a kitchen timer for 13 minutes.. Remove eggs from water once timer is up and let cool for 3 minutes. Gently crack egg around the middle and peel top half of shell. Slide egg out into a small bowl or serve over toast. Season with salt and pepper.

name: Sous Vide Egg Bites
ingredients: {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'eggs'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cottage cheese'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'heavy cream'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': '6 (4-ounce) mason jars'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'serving', 'name': 'cooking spray'}
steps: Fill a large pot with water and place a sous vide immersion cooker into the water. Set temperature to 170 degrees F (77 degrees C) according to manufacturer's directions.. Screw on the lids until just barely tightened. Do not over-tighten as the jars can burst in the hot water.. Submerge mason jars into the water bath and set timer for 55 minutes. Let any remaining jars cool, then refrigerate for up to 1 week.

name: Sous Vide Duck Breast
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(8 ounce)', 'name': 'boneless duck breast halves, skin on'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'fresh thyme leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}
steps: Cut several very shallow crosswise slashes across the skin of each duck breast about 1/2 inch apart. (The cuts should only barely cut into the skin and fat; don't cut into the meat.) Season skin sides with salt, then generously season meat sides with salt, pepper, and thyme. Place into a heavy-duty resealable plastic bag, squeeze out all the air, and seal. Refrigerate for 1 hour.. Fill a large Dutch oven about 2/3 full with water and place over medium heat; heat to 135 degrees F (57 degrees C). Attach a candy thermometer to the side of the Dutch oven in order to monitor and maintain the water temperature. Place a silicone hot pad into the bottom of the pot to keep the plastic bag from contacting the bottom of the pan.. Place the sealed plastic bag into the Dutch oven. Cook, moving the bag around occasionally and adjusting the heat as necessary to maintain the temperature at 135 degrees F (57 degrees C), for 1 hour.. Remove duck breasts from the plastic bag and pat dry. Generously season skin sides with salt.. Heat oil in a skillet over high heat. Place duck breasts, skin-side down, in the hot skillet until fat renders and skin is golden brown, 5 minutes. Turn breasts over and cook until lightly browned and meat still pink in the center, 1 minute. Let rest for 2 minutes before slicing.

name: Sous Vide New York Strip Steak
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(12 ounce)', 'name': 'New York strip steaks'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'vegetable oil, divided'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'cold butter, divided'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'clamshell mushrooms, bottoms trimmed and any bunches separated'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'clove', 'name': 'garlic, crushed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'balsamic vinegar'}
steps: Fill a large Dutch oven about 2/3 full with water. Bring water to 130 degrees F (54 degrees C) over medium heat. Attach a candy or oil thermometer to the side of the Dutch oven in order to monitor and maintain the water temperature.. Generously season steaks with salt and pepper. Heat 1 teaspoon vegetable oil in a large skillet over high heat. Add steaks and cook until just browned, about 1 minute per side. Transfer steaks to a resealable plastic bag, squeeze out all air, and seal.. Place the sealed plastic bag into the Dutch oven, adjusting the heat as necessary to maintain the water temperature at 130 degrees F (54 degrees C). Cook for 2 1/2 hours, moving the bag around occasionally and maintaining the water temperature.. While the steaks are cooking, heat 1 tablespoon butter in the same skillet over medium-low heat. Add mushrooms and cook, stirring occasionally, until soft, about 5 minutes. Transfer to a plate and set aside.. Remove steaks from the plastic bag (reserving any accumulated juices) and pat dry. Stir in reserved steak juices, 2 tablespoons water, and balsamic vinegar. Remove from the heat.. Stir in remaining 1 tablespoon butter until completely melted and incorporated. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Spoon sauce over steaks and serve.

name: Sous Vide Scallops with Garlic and Lemon Butter

steps: Fill a medium pot with warm water. Attach the sous vide and set the temperature to 123 degrees F (51 degrees C) to preheat.. Remove tough muscle from sides of scallops, if present, and lightly season with salt and pepper. Transfer scallops to a resealable plastic bag and remove all the air using the water immersion method.. Place scallops into the preheated water in the pot and cook for 30 minutes.. Remove scallops from the bag and pat dry thoroughly; if scallops are wet, they will not sear well.. Heat olive oil in a small skillet over medium-high heat until it shimmers. name: BBQ Country-Style Pork Ribs - Sous Vide
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'kosher salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'pork spareribs'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'red pepper flakes, or to taste (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'five-spice powder, or to taste (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper, or to taste (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'liquid smoke flavoring, or to taste (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'barbecue sauce, or to taste'}

steps: Place a heat-resistant pad underneath a large pot filled with warm water. Attach a sous vide precision cooker to the pot and set temperature to 135 degrees F (57°C). Set the timer to 24 hours.. Remove all surface fat and silver skin from the roast. Truss the roast and generously season with salt and pepper on all sides.. name: Sous Vide Whole Turkey

steps: Combine chicken stock, salt, rosemary, thyme, savory, and sage in a bowl.. Place turkey in the brining bag and fill with brine, making sure to fill the cavity. Sous Vide Mahi Mahi with Jalapeno-Lime Butter

name: Sous Vide Chicken Thighs
ingredients: {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'black pepper'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'garlic powder'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'paprika'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': '(8 ounce)', 'name': 'bone-in chicken thighs with skin'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'olive oil'}
steps: Fill a large pot with water. Place a sous vide immersion cooker into water and set temperature to 160 degrees F (71 degrees C) according to manufacturer's directions.. name: Sous Vide Salmon

steps: Fill a large pot with water and place a sous vide cooker into the water. Set temperature to 148 degrees F according to manufacturer's directions.. name: Sous Vide Pork Back Ribs
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'dark brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'kosher salt'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'smoked paprika'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'cayenne pepper'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(2 pound)', 'name': 'rack of ribs'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': "barbeque sauce (such as Sweet Baby Ray's®), or more to taste"}

name: Deep-Fried Sous Vide Egg Yolks

name: Sous Vide Flank Steak
ingredients: {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped onion'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'minced fresh rosemary'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'minced garlic'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'extra-virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'good quality balsamic vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'Worcestershire sauce, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(1 pound)', 'name': 'flank steak, cut in half'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste'}

name: Sous Vide Maple-Glazed Carrots

steps: Prepare a water bath with an immersion circulator set to 185 degrees F (85 degrees C).. Cut carrots in half lengthwise and slice into 1/2-inch thick pieces on the bias/diagonal.. steps: Heat water in a sous-vide water bath to 125 degrees F (52 degrees C).. Season scallops with salt and pepper; place scallops in a sealable plastic bag, clustered together. name: Sous Vide Carnitas

steps: Fill a large pot with water and place a sous vide immersion cooker into the water. Set temperature to 165 degrees F (74 degrees C) according to manufacturer's directions.. name: Sous Vide Pork Tenderloin
ingredients: {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'finely chopped yellow onion'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dry white wine'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'unsalted butter'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Dijon mustard'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'white balsamic vinegar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'whole grain mustard'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'turbinado sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'lemon zest'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'kosher salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'dried tarragon, divided'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(1 pound)', 'name': 'pork tenderloins'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'heavy cream'}
steps: Prepare a thermocirculator and water bath according to manufacturer's directions. Set thermocirculator to 135 degrees F (58 degrees C); if you want pork cooked medium instead of medium-rare, set to 145 degrees F (63 degrees C), and allow water bath to come up to temperature.. Combine onion, wine, butter, Dijon mustard, vinegar, lemon juice, whole grain mustard, turbinado sugar, lemon zest, salt, and 1/2 teaspoon tarragon in a medium microwave-safe bowl. Place in microwave and cook on high power until butter melts and sugar dissolves, stirring halfway through, about 1 minute. (This yields 1 1/2 cups sauce).. Place tenderloins in a vacuum-sealable bag with 3/4 cup of the mustard mixture and massage contents of bag to ensure meat is coated evenly in sauce, spacing tenderloins in a single layer in the bag. Seal bag with a vacuum sealer according to manufacturer's directions.. Transfer vacuum-sealed tenderloins to warm water bath with thermocirculator; cover vessel with aluminum foil to reduce evaporation. Wipe skillet clean with a paper towel if any drippings are too dark.. Reduce heat to medium. Add remaining 3/4 cup mustard sauce to skillet and allow to come to a simmer, reducing until slightly thickened, 1 to 2 minutes. name: Pumpkin Spice Creme Brulee

steps: Beat egg yolks in a large bowl; mix in 1/3 cup sugar and salt.. Combine heavy cream, pumpkin pie spice, and vanilla extract in a pot over low heat. name: Sous Vide Prime Rib
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(5 pound)', 'name': 'three-bone standing rib roast, chine bone removed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'kosher salt, divided, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'unsalted butter, cut into 1/2-inch cubes'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'name': 'fresh thyme sprigs'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'flaky sea salt to taste'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'fresh shiitake mushrooms, stemmed and coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dry red wine'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'beef broth'}
steps: Prepare a thermocirculator and water bath according to manufacturer's directions. Set thermocirculator to 135 degrees F (57 degrees C) and allow water bath to come up to temperature. Season rib roast evenly with 1 tablespoon salt and transfer to a large vacuum-sealable bag; arrange butter cubes, thyme sprigs, and crushed garlic around rib roast in bag.. Seal bag with a vacuum sealer according to manufacturer's directions. Transfer vacuum-sealed rib roast to warm water bath with thermocirculator, cover vessel with aluminum foil to reduce evaporation, and cook for 6 hours. Remove rib roast from bag; roast will be at 135 degrees F (57 degrees C) when pulled from water bath. Transfer to a rimmed sheet pan lined with paper towels and gently pat dry; reserve contents remaining in bag.. Preheat the oven to broil with an oven rack positioned about 10 inches below the heat source. Line a rimmed baking sheet with aluminum foil and fit with a wire rack.. Season rib roast evenly with remaining tablespoon salt and pepper and place on the prepared baking pan.. Cook rib roast in the preheated oven until fat cap is deeply caramelized, 8 to 10 minutes. Add beef broth and continue cooking, stirring occasionally, until sauce is thick enough to coat the back of a spoon, about 15 minutes; remove thyme sprigs and discard. name: Sous Vide Turkey Breast
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(2 pound)', 'name': 'turkey breast half (with bones and skin)'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'kosher salt, divided, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'fresh thyme sprigs'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'fresh sage sprigs'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'unsalted butter, cut into 1/2-inch cubes'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Champagne vinegar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'blood orange juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'grapeseed oil'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}
steps: Prepare a thermocirculator and water bath according to manufacturer's directions. Set thermocirculator to 145 degrees F (63 degrees C) and allow water bath to come up to temperature.. Season turkey breast evenly with 1 teaspoon salt and transfer to a large vacuum-sealable bag; arrange thyme sprigs, sage sprigs, and butter cubes around turkey breast in the bag. Seal bag with a vacuum sealer according to manufacturer's directions. steps: Combine 2 tablespoons salt, brown sugar, garlic powder, paprika, onion powder, oregano, and black pepper in a small bowl and mix well.. Place pork pieces into a large bowl.
